item.title: F.R.I.E.N.D.S
item.dc:creator: lithiyum
item.description:

Friends is one of my favorite shows since it truly perfected the sitcom format. It wasn’t as inventive as Seinfeld, but it mastered the sitcom structure in my opinion. …

F.R.I.E.N.D.S Read More »
item.content:encoded:
F.R.I.E.N.D.S

Friends is, in my opinion, the best sitcom of all time. I absolutely adore it, and whenever I replay Friends, it always makes me cry.

Friends is one of my favorite shows since it truly perfected the sitcom format. It wasn’t as inventive as Seinfeld, but it mastered the sitcom structure in my opinion. It is, without a doubt, comfort food.

Let’s come to the parts that I enjoyed the most, which are, of course,

1. Characters and their Interaction
I genuinely adore all of the characters in this program (except Mark of course).
The casting is excellent, and I really like how the performers embody their roles. The actors all put their hearts and souls into their characters, and they’re all quite friendly to one another.The chemistry between the characters, in my opinion, is what distinguishes the characters. Each of the characters has a unique and endearing chemistry with one another. Ross and Rachel are a very legendary pair, despite their destructive relationship. Monica and Chandler have the show’s best relationship. I really enjoyed how Joey and Phoebe complement each other perfectly. Monica and Rachel are wonderful female pals. Joey and Chandler are the ideal brotherly duo.

While the characters are “overexaggerated” in the last season, they are still likable and interesting. They have a lot of depth to them as well. Chandler hides his insecurity and shameful past with sarcasm, Rachel has a thing for doctors because her father is one, Phoebe had a traumatic past but chose to have a positive outlook, Joey is the way he is because of his family, and Ross and Monica are super competitive because of their toxic family structure. Everyone has reached their full potential.

In addition, the supporting characters are notable. Gunther, Mike, Ursula, The Gellers, Chandler’s parents, Joey’s family, Richard, Janice, and others were among the guests.

I also loved how this program addressed toxic masculinity, such as Ross’ dissatisfaction with the male nanny and Ben’s playing with Barbie, as well as parenting, such as Phoebe’s surrogacy, Monica’s adoption, and Rachel’s single parenthood.

The second aspect of Friends that I enjoyed was the

2. Consistency
Friends season 9 was, without a doubt, the worst.

However, I believe it is superior to Office Season 8. Monica and Chandler taking a fertility test, Monica singing, Phoebe meeting Mike, and Rachel’s other sister are among the cast members. But the point is that Friends is a constant in my life. Yes, there were some bumps in the road, but Monica and Chandler’s wedding, as well as Ross and Rachel’s kid, salvaged the series. But one thing I’d want to bring out is how consistent the series is. Like Game of Thrones or The Office, it doesn’t have any weak points for me. It’s still riding that high-quality wave.

I also enjoyed how this show coined new terminology that we are all familiar with. The terms “BFF” and “Friend Zone” are used interchangeably.

3. Iconic Experiences

The show Friends has so many memorable moments. I mean, we’ve already seen the Blackout episode.

ross and rachel’s first kiss

The Football game

We were on a break

The apartment quiz

Rachel came back 

plus a whole lot more .Friends has left a lasting impression on me. It’s well-written, funny, and consistent. It’s like comfort food; when I’m in a foul mood due to the polarized world, I want to escape to a world where I’m surrounded by lovely individuals. It is, without a doubt, my favorite sitcom. It’s a must-see.

item.title: Best Android Apps I have Used
item.dc:creator: lithiyum
item.description:
Best Android Apps I Have Used The best Android apps include a social media giant, a video editor and a game streaming service. Tik Tok TikTok is a social video app that allows you to make short movies while lip-syncing, dancing to tunes, or talking about something you’re passionate about. During the early months of …

Best Android Apps I have Used Read More »
item.content:encoded:
Best Android Apps I Have Used

The best Android apps include a social media giant, a video editor and a game streaming service.

Tik Tok

TikTok is a social video app that allows you to make short movies while lip-syncing, dancing to tunes, or talking about something you’re passionate about. During the early months of the epidemic in 2020, the app’s popularity skyrocketed, with more than 2 billion downloads across the App Store and Google Play. According to Sensor Tower data, TikTok generated 315 million installs in the first quarter of 2020, the highest for any app in a quarter ever.

It’s worth noting that TikTok has being scrutinized by the US government for potential security dangers and privacy violations. The app was recently questioned by the US Senate on the safety of its younger users. Additional legislation to safeguard younger users could result from the hearing.

TikTok is available for free on the Google Play store. It’s also available on iPhone and iPad.

Telegram

Telegram is one of the most popular privacy-focused messaging programs. It has symmetrical AES encryption of 256 bits, 2048-bit RSA encryption, and more. As a result, it is one of the safest messaging systems available. File sharing, cross-platform support, group conversations, GIF support, and more are all included in the app. It’s one of the best security systems, and it’s private enough that some governments don’t want their citizens to use it. It’s more than adequate as a chat service for just about anything you would require.

Stadia

Stadia, Google’s video game streaming service, allows you to play games on your phone, laptop, desktop, or television. The Stadia app serves as a hub for managing your Stadia account, configuring your controller, making purchases, reviewing your captures, and playing games (depending on your phone). While the service has received mixed reviews, the app has received a 3.7 out of 5 star rating in the Google Play store from over 25,000 users.

The Google Stadia software is free to download from the Play Store, but games and the package to connect to it are not.

Call of Duty:Mobile

According to Statista, in the first two months after its debut, Call of Duty: Mobile had 172 million downloads globally. The United States accounted for about 28.5 million of the downloads. While publisher Activision Blizzard had some issues with the mobile edition of the famous first-person shooter game, those issues appear to have been rectified, and users are still downloading the game.

In the Google Play store, Call of Duty: Mobile has over 14 million reviews and a rating of 4.3 out of 5 stars. Call of Duty: Mobile is available for free in the Google Play store, with optional in-game purchases. It’s also available on iPhone and iPad.

Disney Plus

Disney Plus, the streaming service, has maintained its momentum in 2020, winning the Play Store Users’ Choice App award. Disney classics, as well as Star Wars, Marvel, Pixar, and the Simpsons, are among the films and TV shows available on the platform. Disney has already made several improvements to the streaming experience, such as the addition of a resume option.

Disney Plus is available for $8 per month or $80 per year. For $14 per month, you can get Disney Plus, Hulu with Ads, and ESPN Plus, or $20 for Hulu without Ads. The app is available for Android and iOS.

Google Maps

According to Statista, Google Maps has become one of the most popular apps in the United States in terms of audience reach. Incognito mode, a speedometer, traffic incident reporting, and speed trap reporting are all included in the app, making it even more useful (and competitive with Google’s other navigation app, Waze). And new features are added on a regular basis to assist users see when a site is the most congested or to find a more environmentally friendly mode of transportation.

Ablo

Ablo is a communication software that links you with random individuals all over the world and instantly translates your chats and video calls, with the objective of assisting you in learning about another culture, practicing a language, or connecting with people to travel with around the world. Ablo may appear to be a clone of the well-known Chatroulette; however, it has more regulations, and violators are removed off the program.

According to its Play store page, Ablo has received over 10 million downloads and has received a 3.8 out of 5 star rating from over 525,000 users. Ablo is available for free in the Google Play store.

Duolingo

Duolingo makes learning a second, or even a third, language enjoyable. There are 39 languages available in the app, ranging from Spanish and French to Diné (Navajo). Reading, writing, speaking, and listening tasks are included in the gamified classes, as well as rewards for completing each one. There are also forums where you may vent your frustrations about conjugations to other people learning the same language as you, much like in a real classroom.

In the Google Play store, Duolingo has about 12 million reviews, with an average rating of 4.5 stars out of 5. Duolingo is free to download, but you can upgrade to Duolingo Plus for $13 per month or $84 per year, which works out to $7 per month.

item.title: Hello world!
item.dc:creator: lithiyum
item.description: Welcome to WordPress. This is your first post. Edit or delete it, then start writing!
item.content:encoded: Welcome to WordPress. This is your first post. Edit or delete it, then start writing!
